meanings.sent1: Carrying heavy bags can be an encumbrance on your back.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was an encumbrance to our journey.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can feel like an encumbrance.
meanings.sent4: Her worries weighed on her like a heavy encumbrance.
meanings.sent5: The mountain of debt felt like an insurmountable encumbrance.

meanings.sent1: The locked gate acted as an encumbrance to our entry.
meanings.sent2: Strict rules can sometimes serve as an encumbrance to creativity.
meanings.sent3: His overprotective nature became an encumbrance to their friendship.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog was an encumbrance to their visibility.
meanings.sent5: The high walls created an encumbrance to their escape.

meanings.definition: A claim or lien on property
meanings.sent1: The bank placed an encumbrance on the house due to unpaid loans.
meanings.sent2: The legal document stated the encumbrance on the land.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tax bill became an encumbrance on the property.
meanings.sent4: The encumbrance on the estate delayed the sale process.
meanings.sent5: The encumbrance on the title needed to be resolved before the transfer.
